intro: Meliosma echeverryana, commonly known as the Echeverryan Meliosma, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the Meliosmaceae family and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pale green flowers. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, acidic soil to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and is often found in protected conservation areas. Its unique botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists alike.
